question: Which war, lasting from 1914 to 1918, significantly reshaped the political map of Europe?
In what year did the Russian Revolution begin, leading to the overthrow of the Tsarist regime?
The Great Depression, a severe worldwide economic crisis, began in which year?
Which leader spearheaded the Nazi Party in Germany during the 1930s and 1940s?
The dropping of atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki occurred during which war?
Which country declared its independence from British rule in 1947, partitioned into India and Pakistan?
The Cold War was primarily an ideological struggle between which two superpowers?
correctAnswer: The United States and the Soviet Union
incorrectAnswers: The Soviet Union and Great Britain

question: The Berlin Wall, a symbol of the Cold War, was built in what year?
Which movement, beginning in the 1950s and 60s, challenged racial segregation and discrimination in the United States?
What major event marked the end of the Vietnam War in 1975?
incorrectAnswers: The Battle of Dien Bien Phu

question: The Cuban Missile Crisis, a tense standoff between the US and the Soviet Union, occurred in which year?
What significant event prompted the beginning of the Korean War in 1950?
correctAnswer: The invasion of South Korea by North Korea
incorrectAnswers: A civil war between factions in North Korea

question: The formation of the European Economic Community (EEC), a precursor to the European Union, occurred in which year?
Which African nation gained independence from Portugal in 1975 after a protracted war of liberation?
The Tiananmen Square protests, a pivotal moment in Chinese history, took place in which year?
What major event triggered the 1991 Gulf War?
The collapse of which global power structure marked the end of the Cold War?
What significant technological advancement revolutionized communication and information access in the latter half of the 20th century?
Which leader initiated the policy of Apartheid in South Africa?
The Balfour Declaration, which supported the establishment of a Jewish homeland in Palestine, was issued in which year?
The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand, which triggered World War I, took place in which city?
What was the name of the clandestine operation during WWII to break the German Enigma code?
Which agreement, signed in 1975, formally ended the Vietnam War?
The Salt I and Salt II treaties, aimed at limiting nuclear arms, were signed between which two superpowers?
What was the name of the policy implemented by Mikhail Gorbachev in the Soviet Union, characterized by openness and restructuring?
